quest.name: Good for the Soul
journal: Beq Lugg is ready to speak of the metaphysical.
objectives: Search Mount Biran Mines for lumps of pristine clay.
Deliver the lumps of pristine clay to Beq Lugg.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Corporeal and incorporeal aether... I confess I have never had cause to make the distinction.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Did they just say what I think they said? Might there really be a way to help Halric and the others? And help ourselves in the process?

dialogue.name: HALRIC
dialogue.text: ...<mumble>

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I suspect the Crystal Exarch has told you of my past. That I was once a mage of the royal court of Voeburt, and that soulcraft was my field of study.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: The tonic you administered to the patients here is one of the fruits of my labors. I hoped to do great things for the kingdom...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: <sigh> But in the end, my knowledge brought only suffering. A plague the like of which none had ever seen.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: In the hands of unscrupulous men, what should have been my greatest triumph instead became my greatest shame...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You mustn't dwell in the past.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: And now you have a chance to redeem yourself.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: At least the Warriors of Light brought those responsible to justice.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I know that only too well. Alas, the knowledge we require is steeped in such bitter memories.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: That I do. A comforting thought indeed.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Aye, that they did. I shudder to think what might have happened had they not.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: But let us return to the task at hand─finding a means by which we might revitalize these people's incorporeal aether.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Do you think it can be done?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Were the skies still ablaze with primordial Light, I would call it an exercise in futility. But now─now we may have a chance.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: The method I have in mind will entail the conjuring of a familiar. They are able to amplify the energies poured into them, making them the perfect conduit for the aether-revitalizing magicks we will ultimately employ.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If you're about to launch into a lengthy explanation of the metaphysics of your plan─don't bother. I'd rather get on with doing whatever it is that needs to be done, if it's all the same to you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Whatever reagents must be procured, or spells invoked─I'll do it.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...I admire your spirit.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Very well. Your first task will be to gather the necessary materials.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: The purest of waters and finest of clays, as well as a fae lantern brimming with pixie magick.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If you're convinced the resulting familiar could help the patients─fine.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud─the water and clay will be simple enough, but I think you know what we'll have to do to get the lantern.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You don't mean─

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The pixies took quite a liking to us before. If we humor them with our company, I'm sure they'll be willing to help us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Fine. We'll pay a visit to Il Mheg. Though I never thought you would be the one to suggest going back there.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I'm impressed you've been there at all, let alone befriended the fae folk.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Oh, while you're about it, seek out the Nu Mou of Pla Enni. They will be able to supply you with water suitable for our needs.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Right. Let's get this over with, shall we.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: There still remains the matter of the clay. Might I prevail upon you to find it?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Clay from Amh Araeng would likely be best. Know you of anyone who might be able to assist us?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I could ask the miners at Twine.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Well, there are the scavengers at Mord Souq.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Ah, yes! They will be able to point you in the right direction, I am sure.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Scavengers, you say? Well...they may know the lie of the land, but I daresay they are more interested in the trinkets and baubles hiding in the earth than the earth itself. Now, miners on the other hand...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: What's that? You know the miners of Twine? Perfect! Speak with them and you should have no trouble procuring what we need.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: While you and the twins are occupied, I will see if there is aught else I can learn of the stagnation which afflicts the people here.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I have no doubt that the miners of Twine can help you find what we need. While you are away, I will do what I can to learn more about the nature of the patients' affliction.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: I can't stop thinking about that giant Talos we built. Can you imagine what it could do with a matching trolley? It feels like a waste not to build one.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: <sigh> Sometimes I wish we'd never got that trolley running again. Now Jeryk wants more of the bloody things, and refuses to shut up about it.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Forename! Well, what a coincidence!

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: You've come at a good time. We've just this moment finished repairing the Talos and trolley you lot took to Nabaath Areng.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: The trolley was no trouble, but the Talos would have been another matter, had we not had a visit from Master Chai.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: He offered us a share of the leftover building materials from Daedalus Stoneworks, as well as a few trade secrets to help us along.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Clever man, that Chai-Nuzz. He seemed pretty keen on the ideas I had for putting the giant Talos to work.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Like a giant trolley! But Magnus still refuses to see all the good we could do with it...

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: You're entitled to your dreams, Jeryk, but that doesn't mean you can go harassing our guests with them. Master Chai was just being polite.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: And something tells me Forename here didn't come all this way to talk about trolleys. What is it you need, friend?

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: I see. And this...familiar requires clay from Amh Araeng.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: Well, look no further. If anyone can find you some quality clay, it's us.

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: Saying that, it isn't exactly a commodity nowadays... But there must be some lurking somewhere or other, waiting to be dug up.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: If I'm not mistaken, there was a time when they used to take clay from Mount Biran Mines to make adobe bricks.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Place is swarming with coyotes now, but if you're after the good stuff, you could do worse than to look there.

dialogue.name: JERYK
dialogue.text: I still say a trolley for that Talos is a good idea. You agree, don't you?

dialogue.name: THAFFE
dialogue.text: You'll want to be on your guard at the mines. Spend too long peering at the ground, and a coyote is sure to come and bite you on the arse.

dialogue.name: MAGNUS
dialogue.text: Stay safe out there. And remember: you don't need an excuse to come and visit us.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text:
The pixies were constantly confusing me with Alisaie. In jest, I assume. I mean, it's not as if we look that much alike!
We, uh...don't look that much alike, do we?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That had better be the only thing we need from the pixies. If I have to endure one more prank, so help me gods...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: The twins have returned, and in one piece at that. I was convinced the pixies would turn at least one of them into a garden ornament...but no.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...You have the clay, I take it?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Wonderful. We need but combine the clay and the water, then heat the mixture with the fae lantern. After that, it will be a simple matter of settling upon a suitable form, and performing the necessary incantation.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Beq Lugg. I have a question. In the event that we had need of this spell and you weren't around, would it be possible for another to perform the incantation?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Assuming they possessed the requisite skill, yes.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Halric and the others have suffered so much, and I swore to do everything in my power to save them. If there is a chance this spell could do that, I would be the one to invoke it.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...Hmmm. Mayhap you should be the one to do so.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: A deep understanding of the subjects' physical state, combined with a strong desire to help them, can drastically increase the magick's effect. And you are plainly more familiar with these people than I.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I daresay there are few in all of Norvrandt more dedicated to finding a cure. Is that not so, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Absolutely. She's the best woman for the job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Very few. But if aught should go awry...I'll see what I can do.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'll give it my all. For Halric. For Tesleen...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Is that a challenge? Well, I'll be damned if I let it come to that.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Then we are all of a mind on the matter. Alisaie shall be the one to conjure the familiar.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: By the Twelve! Though it was only for a moment, he spoke! There may yet be hope for these people!

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: The girl's resolve is quite impressive. One might almost think she drew strength from another...

dialogue.name: HALRIC
dialogue.text: M... Mothe... Al...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: How is he, Beq Lugg? Did it work?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I believe it did. You and your fledgling familiar have done well.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: If my eyes do not deceive, a hint of color has returned to his soul.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Gods... I would jump for joy if I weren't so exhausted.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We're so close now, Halric...

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: As you are even now in the process of discovering, this magick asks much of the invoker. What you may not have realized is that the same is also true of the subject. As such, we must proceed with caution. However, with further treatment, I have the utmost confidence the boy will make a full recovery.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Observing the reanimation of his stagnant soul has been most enlightening. I will need time to put my theories to the proof, but I believe I can fashion a spell to produce the opposite effect. That is, to induce stagnation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thus enabling our safe transport back to the Source via auracite!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: A thought occurred to me─about this treatment.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Beq Lugg said when the soul is rendered dormant, the mind is separated from the body. That a person becomes incapable of interacting with the world around them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Does that not sound a lot like some of the tempered back in the Source?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Not really. It is the fate of most tempered to become slaves to primals─save in a handful of cases. Or am I missing something?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If I can master this technique─the art of revitalizing the soul─I know of at least one in the Source who could desperately use such treatment.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm not sure I follow...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Ga Bu.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Do you really think it could work?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Ga Bu. His condition is eerily similar to Halric and the others', the only difference being that his soul was suffused with earth-aspected aether from summoning Titan, rather than Light. It follows that if his soul is subject to a similar kind of stagnation, there may be a chance we can save him...right?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Exactly! His condition is uncannily similar to Halric's, is it not? The only difference being that his soul was suffused with earth-aspected aether instead of Light. It follows that if his soul is subject to a similar kind of stagnation, there may be a chance we can save him...right?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Why shouldn't it? Ga Bu's condition is virtually identical to Halric's, is it not? The only difference being that his soul was suffused with earth-aspected aether instead of Light. It follows that if his soul is subject to a similar kind of stagnation, there may be a chance we can save him.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but who is this Ga Bu fellow of whom you speak?

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: ...I see. His condition does sound similar...yet there is much and more about the soul that remains unknown even to me. I say this not to discourage you, you understand, but to remind you that this is delicate work we do here. Work requiring patience.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Of course. And as long as there is hope for the patients here, I will devote whatever time is needed to see this through.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But I refuse to spend that time in idleness. If it's all the same to you, I'd like to stay here with Angelo and continue with their treatment.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The two of you should return to the Crystarium with Beq Lugg and see if you can't make some headway with their newly posited theories.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I would tell you to rest first, but I see you're not to be convinced. Ah, the fire of youth.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us return to the Crystarium, then.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: (-???-)Finally! I've found you!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Kai-Shirr!? What are you doing all the way out here?

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: There's trouble back in Eulmore. Lady Chai's beside herself. Sighing, pacing, the whole lot. Near enough begged me to go and find you.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...Sighing and pacing, you say? It must be urgent.

dialogue.name: BEQLUGG
dialogue.text: I take it I will be returning to the Crystarium alone. Go on, then. It's not as if I have anything for you to do.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Thank you, Beq Lugg.

dialogue.name: KAISHIRR
dialogue.text: Sorry for bothering you and all that, but she says the future of Eulmore's at stake.
